title.narrative: 1.1.2 At least 2 options on safety mechanism suitable for Bangladesh are developed based on effective mapping and coordination among key stakeholders
1.1.2 statement: Sustainable options for locally anchored safety mechanism identified and tested

target.value: Dedicated Sub-Committee established within NHRC for overseeing FoE and protection issues Options for safety mechanism for Bangladesh identified,consulted with key stakeholders Relevant stakeholders aware of best practices in this areas MoU with National Human Rights Commission is drafted on potential roadmap for inclusion in the NHRC’s political agenda

title.narrative: 1.1 Assessment of safety of journalism will be conducted at the beginning and at the end of the project period, using the UNESCO Journalism Safety Indicators

1.1 statement: To improve safety response for media workers in Bangladesh through analysis, monitoring and advocacy for the establishment of measures to decrease risk of violence against journalists, contributing to a more enabling environment for the exercise of Freedom of Express (FOE)

target.value: Progress will be monitored in terms of available support to journalists and media communicators under threat in the areas supported by the project: i) immediate responses, ii) development of options for safety mechanism, iii) embedding within the NHRC of FoE and protections issues as a priority and inclusion of a potential roadmap for a safety mechanism

title.narrative: 1.1.1 Journalists and media communicators in Bangladesh are better equipped with knowledge and access to effective security skills and tools to protect themselves
1.1.1 statement: Immediate media-protection measures are developed and applied

target.value: 505 journalists & communicators have direct access to Safety measures & ability to use them in practice

actual.value: 350 journalists/media workers offline and online at national and local level by arranging webinars and virtual meetings using progressive and innovative approaches to ensure that all beneficiaries have the opportunity to build capacity to protect themselves and to engage in the project.

target.value: Safety protocols and training modules developed and made available to journalists, media communicators, media houses, associations

actual.value: Produced 1 national assessment on risks and threats against media communicators in Bangladesh which has been shared with journalists, communicators and CSOs ; o Produced 1 comprehensive and developed user friendly training manual and 4 modules

title.narrative: 1.1.3 Degree to which journalists, media workers and SMCs have been able to access and use the proposed physical and legal protection tools
1.1.3 statement: Journalists and media communicators in Bangladesh are better equipped with access to effective physical and legal protection tools

target.value: Accumulative number of 70 journalists and media communicators received direct assistance in the form of medical, legal, equipment support or regional relocation

actual.value: 87 total - Through the provision of emergency legal support for journalists and media communicators, 35 people who were in legal distress have received a total of 1.53 million BDT as support. The 49 effected journalists, who incurred injury or harm while on duty, have been provided with a total of 1.93 million BDT

target.value: Strategic cases of attacks against journalists and media communicators are selected after careful documentation, and direct support measures are identified and provided for each
